{"step_by_step_thinking": "In pregnancy, the vasopressor of choice should have minimal effects on the uteroplacental circulation and should not adversely affect the fetus. Ephedrine is commonly used in pregnancy as it has both alpha and beta adrenergic effects, which helps maintain blood pressure without compromising uteroplacental blood flow. Phenylephrine is a pure alpha-1 agonist and may cause vasoconstriction and decrease uteroplacental blood flow.
